result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Ronald Lascelle

records.addlTxt: Defendant David Ronald Lascelle in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Patrick J. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for scheduled jury trial.  Defense request for adjournment to allow defense more time to review discovery heard and granted.    Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Jury trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Notice Of Intent To Offer Certified Medical Records - received

Defendant David Ronald Lascelle in court with Attorney Eric Hart for Attorney Richard Henry Hart appeared via zoom.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pre trial.  The final pretrial was held via zoom.  Parties remain in trial posture. State put their offer on the record which was rejected by the defendant.  Jury trial remains scheduled on 7/25/22 at 9:00am in Branch 28.
State's Witness List   Received and Filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant David Ronald Lascelle in court with Attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Dennis Patrick Murphy, appearing for Patrick Anderson, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for trial.
Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Defendant's Preliminary Motions In Limine and Pretrial Motions - received

Defendant David Ronald Lascelle in court with Attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of  any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (2/4/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with R.G (dob 11/8/1962).
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant David Ronald Lascelle in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a NOT GUILTY pleas as to COUNTS 2 and 3.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
